Articles.Content: <figure class=""><img alt="image" src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/f877983c4f5dc185bb3b4a0e8611b711/tumblr_inline_njb2ikvPex1rr2wit.jpg"/></figure><figure class=""><img alt="image" src="https://31.media.tumblr.com/d2e89d310bc6fc0625d034ffec3b48fd/tumblr_inline_njb2khk3LW1rr2wit.png"/></figure><p>The <b><a href="http://goo.gl/fUKJUn">BOXSAT</a></b> mod allows you to build a satellite that can be customized with different modules. On top of that this mod, when used together with the <a href="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/92514">Kerbal Attachment System</a>, allows you to change out the modules of the satellite after it has been launched. Support for <a href="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/83305">Remote Tech 2</a> and <a href="http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/threads/12384">Mechjeb</a> is also present.<br/></p>
Sounds interesting! I'll never get to use it though.
OH COME ON! How did Destruction Effects not make the Modding Monday?
This is the kind of polish I am hoping can be put into stock parts post-launch
I like this mod. Hoping they can let the kerbals to carry the box, not just the instrument inside.

OH COME ON! How did Destruction Effects not make the Modding Monday?
This is the kind of polish I am hoping can be put into stock parts post-launch

This is the kind of polish that D'Effects doesn't have
BoxSat for stock!

OH COME ON! How did Destruction Effects not make the Modding Monday?
I have to agree, this one has been featured before (fairly recently) and there have been several good mods released just in the last month. Kerbal CCTV would have made a good choice as well. (Not that I have anything against BoxSat)

There's a thing called "courtesy", and another called "respect". A good example of both, for instance, would be not raining on another mod author's parade just because your personal pet project of the day was not selected. Anonymity may protect you from consequences, but that has never been and will never be an excuse for handing in your consideration at the door when you get on the internet. Aren't we supposed to be an especially mature and rational community here? Besides, Modding Mondays isn't a competition. You could congratulate DasPenguin and Orcmaul on a job well done/recognition well deserved, and express your hopes for a future feature of Destruction Effects at the same time - all without coming across rude.

P.S.: Boxsat has never been featured before in the entire history of Modding Mondays.

Edited February 10, 2015 by Streetwind

This mod is a nice bit of work and should prove very entertaining.

I do not think it should be added as stock. Primarily because of memory limitations of the game.

This mod requires the 'grab' and 'place' functions of KAS to get any real use out of it.

I feel that these two functions should be included in stock.

I just thought I should point out that the changing of parts of a satellite in space was "the idea" as mentioned by the creator of the mod.

I feel that other mod makers would welcome the "Grab" and "Place" functions as stock game functions.

Being able to add and remove items to a vessel in orbit, even fuel lines and struts, as part of the vanilla game would be a big plus even for those who prefer unmodded installations.

Edited February 10, 2015 by Daveroski
clarification

I've seen this one used before on twitch, and someone suggested it to me other day to try. I may think about giving it a try at some point. It would be useful, especially for tiny probes that I tend to send out early in planetary exploration missions

Well spoken.

This mod is a nice bit of work and should prove very entertaining.

I do not think it should be added as stock. Primarily because of memory limitations of the game.

This mod requires the 'grab' and 'place' functions of KAS to get any real use out of it.

I feel that these two functions should be included in stock

Not really. KAS allows you to reconfigure the BoxSats on the fly, but without that they are still cool solo satelites.

I use them for my Relay satelites (still have KAS, but had a need to reconfigurating a BoxSat yet)

I do not think it should be added as stock. Primarily because of memory limitations of the game.

Lol, BoxSat is roughly 16mb (13 without prototype parts), and if Squad gets their crap together and implements load on demand for textures... they could easily implement it.

There's a thing called "courtesy", and another called "respect". A good example of both, for instance, would be not raining on another mod author's parade just because your personal pet project of the day was not selected. Anonymity may protect you from consequences, but that has never been and will never be an excuse for handing in your consideration at the door when you get on the internet. Edited February 10, 2015 by Alshain

Well spoken.

Not really. KAS allows you to reconfigure the BoxSats on the fly, but without that they are still cool solo satelites.

I use them for my Relay satelites (still have KAS, but had a need to reconfigurating a BoxSat yet)

Just how does that make what I said "Not Really?"

Just how does that make what I said "Not Really?"

Because you don't NEED the KAS mod to use BoxSat?

You said this:

"This mod requires the 'grab' and 'place' functions of KAS to get any real use out of it."

And he said this:

"Not really. I use them for my Relay satelites and have never used KAS functions with any of them"

Therefore, BoxSat has many additional/possible functions WITHOUT the use of KAS mod which means that it's "Not really" true that the mod requires the 'grab' and 'place' functions of KAS to "get any real use out of it."

Also, awesome mod...will be using this to explore CaptRobau's Outer Planets.

Lol, BoxSat is roughly 16mb (13 without prototype parts), and if Squad gets their crap together and implements load on demand for textures... they could easily implement it.

So you feel that arbitrarily adding 16 megs, that many users wouldn't want as a permanent addition; is a good thing?

I feel I'd enjoy playing with it for a while, but I certainly wouldn't want it using space that I could be using for the astronomer pack, or one of many other mods I like to use.

- - - Updated - - -

"This mod requires the 'grab' and 'place' functions of KAS to get any real use out of it."

If you are going to use a quote to try to badmouth someone, at least quote it correctly.

If you are going to use a quote to try to badmouth someone, at least quote it correctly.

I was in no way attempting to badmouth you. I was trying to assist you in understanding what the above poster had said to you and why YOUR assumption is "Not really" true. Put your anger away...just because people disagree doesn't mean they are "badmouthing" anyone.

As a point of fact, you are wrong. BoxSat does NOT REQUIRE KAS to "get any real use out of it". You can use them for many, many other things that don't require swapping out parts on the sat...for example as Sirrobbert said...a relay satellite.

I was in no way attempting to badmouth you. I was trying to assist you in understanding what the above poster had said to you and why YOUR assumption is "Not really" true. Put your anger away...just because people disagree doesn't mean they are "badmouthing" anyone.

First of all, I have no anger towards you. To have anger towards something you need to care if it exists or not. And I don't. If anything, rather than anger me, I would say that you bore me.

Secondly, My comment wasn't even to you. Where do you get off replying for others?

Thirdly and finally. You are just plain rude. My comment was accurate and I stand by it.

As you are not the OP I will not waste time replying to you again.

1. Good, because based on your demeanor and attitude I would never want to, nor give you a chance to know who I am or what I'm about. The fact that you come on and try to bully people into not commenting on anything you disagree with and then come back with this response tells me all I need to know about you.

2. What does it matter? I am entitled to my opinion as well as you are. I can respond to any message I so choose. Where do you get off telling someone (on an internet forum nonetheless) what they can and can't reply to? And as a point of fact (again), you were wrong in your insinuation that BoxSat is basically worthless without KAS.

3. There was nothing at all rude about what I said. The fact is that BoxSat (the mod in question) does not require, nor is it rendered worthless without KAS.

4. Good, then we shall not have to read through your drivel anymore.

Let us stop with the back and forth bickering, please.

Please return to the topic at had, which is the lovely Boxsat mod (and it is indeed lovely, I've been meaning to try it).

Boxsat is kinda fun. Because they're so...boxy...I pack a few into a payload and throw them into highly elliptical orbits around Jool on any save. (I use AntennaRange) Instant coverage!

NINJA EDIT: I wrote a ModuleManager config to support it. I'll put it out on request if need be.
